paper_abstract: A free surface Lattice Boltzmann (LB) model -based on a two-fluid system- is considered to simulate the flow of water in an irrigation canal. We compare the behavior of our numerical simulations with simple experiments and theoretical results obtained from the Saint-Venant equation, the partial differential equation commonly used to describe water flow in irrigation canals. The case study we consider are (1) the height of water along the canal in a stationary regime and (2) a draining experiment. The comparisons show that the two-fluid LB approach captures correctly the draining speed and the qualitative water profile.
paper_title: Modeling of irrigation channels - A comparative study
